info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 19 at 8:41PM EST until January 20 at 1:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST /NOON CST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour possible with the heavier lake effect snow bands. Storm total snow accumulations in excess of 30 inches across portions of northern La Porte County. Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility expected at times due to snow and potentially blowing snow. * WHERE...In Indiana, Northern La Porte, Southern La Porte and Western St. Joseph IN Counties. In Michigan, Southern Berrien County. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST /noon CST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow bands across southwest Lower Michigan will shift back southwest overnight tonight bringing additional moderate to heavy lake effect snow showers late tonight into early Saturday. Due to the nature of lake effect snow, conditions can vary significantly over very short distances, going from just flurries to whiteout conditions over the span of just a few miles. This can also result in highly variable snowfall totals over short distances.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
